intro: Arnica spathulata, commonly known as the broadleaf arnica, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow-orange flowers and hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are usually broad and lance-shaped, with a rough texture, while its flowers bloom in late summer. Arnica spathulata is often used in traditional medicine for its anti-inflammatory properties.
